results.title: The Web
results.creator_credit: Fiona Eagger, Eco Productions, Film Victoria, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Australian Film Commission, New South Wales Film and Television Office, ABC-TV (Australia), Lucinda Clutterbuck, Sarah Watt and Elisa Argenzio
results.brief_description: Narrated by Ruth Cracknell and superbly animated, thirteen short segments focus on the survival of endangered creatures in their fragile habitats. The emphasis is on highlighting the plight of the animals and to foster greater community respect. Preservation of wildlife and their habitats are crucial environmental issues, and this program of short films promotes this message simply and persuasively. The Panda, Wolf, Bandicoot, Cheetah, Shark, Rhinoceros, Falcon, Rattlesnake, Spider, Seal, Gorilla, Frog and Homo Sapiens are the animals featured. Suitable for Upper Primary students and for lovers of quality animation and wildlife.

results.title: The Weather map
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Christopher Cordeaux
results.brief_description: Explains how to interpret a weather map and how the Bureau produces it daily from the information collected by stations throughout Australia. Aimed at upper primary-, lower high school-aged students.

results.title: The Weather
results.creator_credit: Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Rob Gell’s environment series”.
Explains, in simple terms, the origin of weather patterns we experience each day. The origin and extent of various types of storms are investigated.

results.title: The Weather
results.brief_description: The circulation of the air about the earth’s surface, the progress of a wave cyclone with detailed consideration of the cold and the warm front, and the instruments used in weather observation, are studied in this film.

results.title: The Weapon of choice
results.creator_credit: Sue Crowther, Nihon Hoso Kyokai, WGBH (Boston) and Central Independent Television (UK)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Nuclear age”.
This program looks at the political, military and technological events that contributed to the Cold War between the Soviet Union and the United Statesof America. As tension rose between the two “Super-Powers’, the nuclear arms race began in earnest. When the Soviet Union exploded its first atomic bomb in 1949, President Truman stirred considerable controversy by deciding to pursue the development of the hydrogen bomb, six hundred times more powerful than the Hiroshima bomb. By 1953, the U.S. atomic arsenal had grown to over 1000 weapons.

results.title: The Weakest link
results.creator_credit: British Foundation Pictures and Ronald Haines
results.brief_description: A very interesting film showing a community in England hand forging and forming of chain links. Both women and men working with primitive machines using methods that are timeless.

results.title: The Ways of water
results.brief_description: A study of water movement, currents, tides and waves and its application in irrigation and canal control. Filmed at the Hydraulic Research Station, Wallingford, England.

results.title: The Wayne manifesto: this guy Dellafield
results.creator_credit: Alan Hardy, Artist Services, Film Queensland, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Paul Moloney
results.brief_description: In ‘This guy Dellafield’, Wayne’s first day at school does not look like it’s going to be a good one, especially when he has school bullies and a tyrannical teacher to deal with. In the second episode ‘A slave to fashion’, Wayne is convinced that he hasn’t made any new friends at school; apart from Rosie, the young girl next door. In an effort to rectify the situation, Wayne blows his chance as making it as a triangle player in Squaka’s band. Cast includes Jeffrey Walker (Wayne), Jah’shua McAvoy, Tracey-Louise Smith and Brooke Harman.
